text:
Draught at Ølfestival 2017. 
Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hay, caramel and hops.
Malty flavour of caramel, hay and hops.
Hoppy finish.
Duft frisk citrus svag malt sød kant Smag frisk lime citrus lime malt kant frisk
Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aromas of citrus, sweet malty, biscuits, floral. Taste is light bitter, corn, biscuits, pale malt.
Tap. Aroma of herbal, earthy hops, some malt. Clear straw colour with white head. Taste is dry, light bitter and straw. Light body, dry feel and light bitter finish.

On tao@ pours slightly clear, golden with dissipating white head. Aroma: diatecyl, bread like malt notes, floral, fruity hop character...flavour follows aroma: diacetyl, bread like malt notes, floral, fruity hop notes, notes of oxidation. Medium hop bitterness.
Slightly dry, bitter finish, bitterness lingers long in aftertaste. Medium to full body, soft texture, moderate carbonation.

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2017. Clear, deep golden colour with a fluffy white head. Sweet aroma with hay, pale malts, floral notes, butter, grasses, earthy hops. Taste is light bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and bitter. Easy drinking and super crisp Pils.
Pena dlho nedrzi. Vona sa takmer hned strati. Chut horka prijemna na osviezenie. Na konci stale horke - asi az moc..

On tap and growler fill at Lager Lager, Berlin. Shared at Craft Beer Stammtisch. Pours with an intense, clear golden color and a nice white head with large bubbles. The nose is foral hops, cereals and slightly fruity. Taste is grassy and herbal, nice malts, cereals and just hints of fruit . Nice bittersweet finish.
Tap. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of breast malts, citrus, Fruity, slight minerals. Taste is rather bitter, fruity, bready, clean and fresh. Wauw

0,1l from tap at Salon Piva, Bratislava shared by Saeglopur, big thanks. golden clear color, small white head. smells chlorophyl, bit soapy, grassy, bit buttery. not overly fresh smell. medium body, soft carbonation, slick moutfheel. tastes grassy, herbal, chlorophyl, grainy, peppery, light ripe fruits. finishes lightly bitter with notes of grains, chlorophyl and some peppery notes. tastes rather oldish, overall still drinkable but not overly exciting.

Draught at Salon Piva, Bratislava. 
Deep golden, clear body, with a big, creamy, lacing, white head. 
Aroma of grains, flowers, herbs, bread, some honey, some sweet fruits, some soap. 
Tastes similar, also with some soap. 
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. 
Finishes bitter, medium dry, herbal, grassy, floral, grainy, a bit sweet. 

Nice one. The soapy notes are a bit distracting, but not that much, still really quaffable. Nice herbal and floral notes throughout. If this wasnt for the slight off-notes, this would be a great Pils.

From tap at Salon Piva, Bratislava. Clear light golden with a white head. The aroma is lightly malty - grains, bread, butter. Medium body with a light sweetness and a medium bitterness. The flavor is malty with grains, a little buttery, dried apples and a decent bitter hoppy finish, yet balanced.

Draft 0.5l at Samo Pivo Belgrade, Serbia. 12.04.2017. Taste with Ogi and Vlada. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma nice pleasent grassy hoppy feel. Taste perfectly balanced, malty, cereal, smooth texture, grassy hoppy finish, really nice fresh and once again perfectly balanced. Really suprised with this one! medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish.
srdcovka jak cyp, pitelnej lezak neskutecne, muzu kdykoli a kdekoli a ten riz!
25-03-17 // draught at Koutská piváreň in Bratislava. Clear golden, white head. Aroma is light malty, soem grains and cereal. Mild bitter finish with herbal touches.

Z nalewaka 1l. pet. Kolor złoty z tymi pięknymi błyskami, piana dobnopęcherzykowa, biała wspaniale zdobi szkło. Aromat chmielowy a w tle beczka, smak słodowo-chmielowy, rześki. Przepyszny lager, cieszę się, że trafiłem na taki.
On tap at LuppoloStation in Rome-Italy with Mortlach and daniele. Nose: cookies, bread crumb, grass and flowers. Mouth: lovely feel of cereals with a relevant bitterness. Great Bohemian pils!

on tap golden clear good head cereal malty light butter herbal dry
oro limpida buona schiuma persistente cereale filo diacetile discreto maltato erbaceo

Czeską dwunastkę zamówiłem, gdyż skończyły mi się inne, ciekawe propozycje w lokalu! Nie spodziewałem się wiele, ale pierwszy rzut oka na zawartość szklanki zachęcił mnie znacząco. Ładna, złota barwa. Piwo klarowne. Do tego fantastyczna, puszysta, pokaźna, biała piana. Aromat bardzo przyjemny - słodowy, delikatny, z lekką nutą chmielową. W smaku również nie ma się do czego przyczepić. Lekka goryczka, fajna baza słodowa. Piwo lekkie, bardzo pijalne, bardzo zrównoważone! Myślę, że tak powinien smakować pilsner!
Plastic bottle from the importer. crazy bottle but the beer incredible pils.

Plastic bottle. After this initial spoiler, everything as expected: clear yellow, subdued carbonation, creamy white head. Aroma malts, citruses, some mango? Very fresh clean taste, nice bitter-sweet balance. Hoppy finish.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 
Lukt: Søtlig humle og malt, noe dropsaktig.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Søtlig humle og malt, noe dropsaktig.
Hvor: NMBCo, Sandnes.

Pre mńa je to jeden z najlepśich Českých leźiakov...
Výborná pena , skvelá rezkosť..príjemná a vyváená horkosť.
Odporúčam kadému kto má rád leiaky.

At the ChurchKey in D.C. A fluffy white head on an amber-gold body. A significant nose features sweet malt and candied fruit. The candied fruit continue into the taste profile, combining well with German malt and a solid dense mouth feel. Tasty summer fare.
#793Tap. Clear deep golden body, medium white head. Aroma of malts, noble hops. Taste is sweet, lightly bitter. Malts, bread, touch of grassness. Medium body and carbonation. Quite good.
Draught at Arts Café, Kralupy n. Vlt. Clear, gold colored. AROMA- yeasty, malt, grain. FLAVOR- lightly sweet, slightly bitter, malty, spicy hops. Medium bodied. Good lager.

1.5l PET bottle. Slightly murky golden body, white head. Aroma of bread, honey, biscuit, green apples, grassy hops and some grains. Taste of bread, grains, honey and pears with grassy and floral hops. Definitely fruitier than the average pilsner. Very nice.

Numerous pours over the past five years: Toasted golden. Fine, persistent white head. Polished malt aromatics of cookie and pecan harmonize with vividly expressed tealike, grassy and lemon candy hops. Notably soft mouthfeel. Graceful carbonation. Lush grassy malt immediately envelops the mouth, gradually progressing into crisper notes of candied pecan which testify to the beautifully decocted malt. Hoppy succulence pervades with appetizing grass and spice characteristics. Sappy oils ooze from the sparkling yet rustic hoppiness, soothing the palate as sassier wood-root spices and tealike notes sizzle fervidly. A metallic twinge of grassy hops aligns with toasted piecrust maltiness in the cohesive finish. Another gem from Kout that exhibits all the old world charm Ive come to expect from them. Remarkably well-rounded and mind-bogglingly nuanced.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Tap @ Csehsörnapok, 2016. Igazi kvasnicovy, szinte erzem az élesztőt a nyelvemen.

On tap at Le ?enk Craft Beer Cafe, Bratislava. Mild malty aroma with notes of grass and hints of fruits and herbs. Moderate sweet with mild flavours and a nice bitterness. Well balanced, easy to drink and quite enjoyable. Nothing too impressive, thou, but maybe its not the freshest one. Still a decent pilsner.
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear deep golden with white head. Aroma of flowers, some diacetyl. Tastes sweet with some bitterness, bitter finish.

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Clear deep golden colour, moderate white head. Lovely hoppy aroma of newmown grass and fresh herbs. The medium dry flavour is well hopped throughout, with very distinct bittering hops in the finish. The malty backbone is sufficient. A very well made pilsener.

Draught at Kings Head Pub on 4/2/16.Dont for sure know this isnt the kvasnicovne version, and in the States these are always just listed as Koutska followed by the number, so there was no way to tell anyways, but the beer had no haze (not that that means anything necessarily) and I assume the kvasnicovne version stays closer to the origin (though technically the yeast would help preserve the beer longer). Anyways, putting my rating here.A light amber-golden body is topped by a medium-sized, well-retained head. Interesting, would have thought this to be pale golden. Clarity is high.In the nose, it reminds me of Andechs. Not that theres a similarity in aroma, but rather, it has that same, elegant, charming yeast character that shows complex minerality and vague, dainty fruit notes. Behind that, there is light caramel and red berry-like character from the specialty malts and rich honey-drenched bread from the pils malt. Hops are nicely balanced; this isnt a grass/floral/spice bomb, yet the moderate spiciness does help balance the malt, gently. No alcohol or flaw in the nose.Similar profile to the flavor, being more malt forward, with definite sweetness and yet a drying, lightly biscuity/bready finish replete with light fruitiness, hints of caramel and plentiful spicy hops. Carbonation is gentle, but mostly tight, with a soft, malty texture. At first I thought it might be a bit too malty, and for sure its malt-forward, but the complex flavors that are created by yeast and specialty malt are just too endearing to not fall in love with. I happily ended up ordering a second pint. Its very cool that this isnt just some random Urquell knockoff (not that I expected it would be) and this brewery is a very strong 2/2 in my book. Excited to find more.

On tap @ The Trappist. Have been wanting to try this beer for some time, so was excited to see it on the menu. Clear golden beer with a dense white head. Unfortunately, doesnt seem to be in pristine condition...shocker. Still, I think its pretty nice, though. Has some chewy bread dough, honey, biscuit, and light esters of baked apple. Subtle bitterness of grass and orange rind.
Draft at Churchkey. Poured a clear dark yellow color. Fruity malts, light herbal hops, light citrus. Mild grass. Decent.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2016 4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Shared by radagast83, thanks Chris! Mostly clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of malt, corn, wheat. Tastes of sweet malt, corn, wheat. Light body with a dry finish.

Half liter on tap at the Foundry. Glad I had this after fairly recently trying a somewhat disappointing Pilsner Urquell after many years. This offering is more 21st Century, with hop bitterness forward, but hardly overpowering. Looks like beer, smells bready, tastes of hay, malt, barnyard, mild spice, hops and sweetness. Extremely drinkable and pleasantly balanced brew with enough complexity to make it interesting throughout. Absolutely deserves wider distribution... a fine beer.
Tap at Le Senk, golden to copper clear color with medium white head.Aroma of malt, yeast, hops. Taste is nice balanced, good malty backbone, dry bitter finish.good
Tap at halmicaffe. Clear golden colour with white head off. Aeoma of malts,bread. Taste of caramel,malt,light bitter aftertaste. Great lager

Tap 0.3 l, Targowa, Wrocław, Poland.
Złote piwo z puszystą i sztywną, ładnie oblepiającą szkło pianą oraz przyjemnym, lekko chmielowym aromatem. W smaku pełne, słodowe z wyrazistą chmielową goryczką na finiszu.
clear golden color. high creamy white head. aroma. malty aroma. palate medium carbed low. siropy sweet and alcohol present in taste. their 10 is better.

Nefiltrovane 1.5L. Beautiful dark yellow cloudy pour. Soft noble hop and caramel nose. very bitter for a Pilsner, but works well with the full body. Smooth, long finish. Finishes with a little dance on the taste buds.. Classic.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich grassy hops, flowers, straw and malt. Nice grassy bitter finish.

Slightly hazy, golden to orange colour with medium and stable head. Moderate aroma of malty, bready base with hint of spicy bitterness. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter (spicy and grassy) with long crispy finish. Medium carbonation. Medium to full body. Perfect balance, refreshing and crispy. Solid body too. Fantastic bohemian pilsener.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 131215

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 5%. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, caramel, grainy, grass, and hop. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, grass, little grainy, hop, saaz, little sweet and medium bitter.

Probably the greatest lager Ive ever had. Super bitter but super balanced malt body. This beer absolutely shines and is a completely different beast compared to the 10 degree. Both stand proudly on their own but this one ranks way up there for me.

W aromacie rześki przyprawowy chmiel, nieco zbożowej słodowości, bardzo przyjemnie, acz wyłazi aldehyd octowy, który trochę psuje odbiór. W smaku dość goryczkowe, nieco zbyt szorstkie, przyprawowe, ponownie podwyższona chlebowa pełnia i ponownie zielone jabłuszko. Pijalne i smaczne mimo wad.

Podejrzenia o kolejnego słodowo-diacetylowego czeskiego lagera zostają rozwiane już na samym wstępie. Piwo zniewala potężnym uderzeniem szlachetnej ziołowości chmielu Saaz, chlebową podbudową, ba nawet lekką estrową owocowością, która tutaj pasuje jak ulał. W smaku dość wysoka, niezwykle przyjemna goryczka, skontrowana świetną słodową podbudową, o zdecydowanie chlebowym charakterze. Wysycenie w punkt, piwo jest rześkie i pijalne jak diabli. Czapki z głów!

Backlog rating. Keg at Mother Kellys, London. It pours a clean golden color with medium creamy white head. Aroma is clean grass, some citrus, straw and grains. Taste has more grains, lemon peel, grass and herbaceous notes. Finishes quite dry. Light bodied with sparkling carbonation. Overall, nice

On tap @Mad For Beer (Rome). Pours a vivid golden color with a medium white foam. Aroma is malty, biscuits, light diacetyl, grass. Flavour is malty, light sweet and mild bitter, not so clean. Medium to light body, light carbonation. Quite ok.

1.5 Litre bottle. This is a great beer. Spicy noble hops beautifully balanced with well crafted malt profile. More up the fruity end of the spectrum than savoury biscuit malty pils. Im moving to CZ. Thanks Dave.

@Le Senk in Bratislava. Lightly hazy golden body, large white head, and soapy lacing. Citrusy with some grainy cereals, florals, and light garss. Medium to light bodied, moderate to lively carbonation, dry, crisp.

Koutský 12° Světlý Leák - Bohemian Pilsener - 5%. 

Deep gold color, clear, thick creamy white head. Thick body, syrupy, loads of malt with fruity overtones. Resin on the hops side. Good banance, starts juicy sweet and finish biting bitter, with a wonderful tray of hops lingering. Finish is smooth, moderately bitter, long, hoppy. Tasty czech pilzener but i liked the unfiltered version more (kvasnicovy).
From tap. Clear golden color with off white head. Malty grainy aroma, straw, grassy. Sweet and bitter taste. Light to medium almost oily body with average carbonation.

9/VII/15 - 1.5L PET bottle from a trade @ dormitory (Olomouc) - BB: n/a (2015-887)  Thanks to Motelpogo for the trade!
Clear blond to orange beer, small creamy off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of grains, wort, hay, bit fruity. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: hoppy start, pretty grassy, little fruity, touch of (green) banana, wort. Aftertaste: bitter, some citrus, lots of grains, bit of caramel, bay leaf, fruity notes, hoppy finish, sweet wort as well.

Draft at The Jeffrey decided to stick around for one more. Fine orange yellow pour soapy head good retention. Nose is alice and cereal. Tastes quite peppery, of straw, juniper, cereal, grass, hint of tropical fruit. Semi sweet finish. This is good

On tap at Le Senk Bratislava . I guess you could say its still "just a pilsener" and the difference between an average one and good one might be subtle but I think youd have to be nuts not to notice a difference . Pale body white lasting head and lacing . Sweet grainy fruit and hop aroma. Taste is sweet and well balanced with a hoppy bitterness . Lasting bitter finish. Very refreshing. Pretty awesome for the style. Also only 1.5 euro for a 500 ml glass on tap. Great beer.

Golden colored, clear, small to moderate white head, nice lacing. Aroma is malt, some caramel, candy and fruity, even some green apple. Taste is malt, moderate sweet, some grains, some fruity candy, moderate bitter noble hoppiness. Low to medium bodied and moderate carbonation. This is way too fruity, takes over the hops and green apples dont help. Guess I should give this one another try...
Draft. Golden beer with a whitish head. Bready and malt aroma. Bready flavor with light grass. Medium bodied. Grass and breadiness lingers with light spice.

Prezentacja:
złote, klarowne, piana średnia, trwała, koronka niezła
;
Aromat: 
słodowy, miód, brzoskwinia
;
Odczucie:
ciało niskie, nasycenie średnie, finisz lekko goryczkowy
;
Smak: 
delikatna goryczka, reszta za aromatem
;
Ogólnie:
pijalne
.
Draft. Clear bright yellow color, fluffy white head with spider web lacing. Beautiful peppery haystack aroma. Taste is peppery lemon, clean and crisp. Very tasty.

The beer is a very nice pilsener. Pours with a lot of head, brown-golden, smell is fresh and hoppy. Taste is mildly flat with pronounced carbonation. A gentle dry aftertaste finishes the beer. Quite good.
Točený polliter v pube Čierna hora. Pena aj v farba v pohode, chuť lahodná, silne chmelová, Pivo silne piteľné, koda, e nebol čas, dal som len 3 kúsky. Suprový leák!

Draft at BD ShepBush. Pours crystal clear deep burnished gold, persistent creamy tight offwhite head that leaves good lace. Nose of spicy Saaz, hay, bread, slightly caramelised cereal. Tastes medium sweet, light caramel and full cereal malt flavours, moderate to medium bitter with prominent clean, spicy woody hop character, touch of buttery diacetyl. Medium light body, slightly oily slightly creamy texture, moderate to softish fine carbonation, lingering clean woody spicy slightly herbal hop flavours. Wow, this is really nice - if all lager tasted this good Id drink it lot more often...
taste of very well balanced malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness with some minimal cardboard notes
Tap. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and bready notes.

Tap. Pours crystal clear amber, small off white head, some lacing. Aroma is grain, grass, a bit of bread. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, bready, a bit of yeast, grassy. Light body, lingering bitterness. A bit harsh on the finish. Solid.

1,5 litre plastic bottle shared with JMD 26.12.14. Foamy and persistent off-white head and lacing. Fine, and slightly spicy, aroma and taste of Czech hops. Well balanced with malt. Bitterness lingering on in aftertaste. Very high drinkability.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 1,5 liters plastflaske (med håndskrevne datoer på etiketten - tappet 05.12.14, best før 05.01.15!), ufllitrert, håndimportert av skibsreder Ovesen: uklar gylden med varig skum. Deilig bitterhet med litt sitron og krydder. Servert kjøleskapskald, en herlig pilsner og en lovende start på årets siste aktivitetsdag på Holmen! Fra fat (filtrert men fortsatt upasteurisert) på Mi2 juni-16: slik skal en pilsner smake! Deilig bitterhet med urter og gress, nydelig balansert (eneste humle skal være Saaz) og lang, tørr ettersmak. Bare blide fjes å se rundt bordet.

Clear golden colour, pleasant smell of grass, malt and some wild flowers too. 
Good crisp bitterness with taste of superb bouquet of czech premium hops. Almost perfect balance with medium sweet enough bread body. Not worse then prazdroj!
On tap at Zubaty Pes, Prague. Pours clear golden with small white head. Malty aroma. Malty flavor, light caramel and light bitterish finish. Very drinkable. Good one.

Drunk firstly in slovanske lipy, then again in the bar round the corner from me. sitting outside with cam and rachel after work, it was great. pours clear deep golden. huge fluffy white head. smell is grassy, grain, butter, fresh hops. taste is similar. crisp as fuck, with grassy hops, backed up by solid maltiness. perfectly balanced, absolutely delicious svetly. best ive ever had

clear darker golden colour, huge white head; aroma of herbal-floral hoppy notes, some grass, caramel notes and hints of overripe fruits; taste of very well balanced malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness with some minimal cardboard notes; great carbonation; excellent Czech pilsner

500 ml on tap at Wench Pub. Dark gold, pretty clear, with a huge, creamy, fluffy and persistent off white head. The nose is dominated by papery/wet cardboard notes, but there is a pleasent honey, toffee and caramel malts presence. A hint of fresh herbs too. Smooth and easy drinking, more sweet than bitter. Ridicolously clean and refreshing. Grassy, noble hop like finish. Mild peppery edge. Soft to average carbonation, medium body, creamy texture. Very curious to try it fresh and as close as possible as the brewery. Still, great pils.

Draft a Proletariat. Pours gold with a white head. Lightly sweet malty base, with some bready and biscuity notes, faint balancing grassy bitterness, and a quick finish with additional hints of sweet malts. Sharp and lively, but not as fresh and bright as Id hoped. Certainly good, but a bit underwhelming.

PET láhev 1500 ml. Aroma je lehce kvasnicové s jemným chmelovým nádechem. Pěna je jasně bílá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je pomerančová a silně kalná. Chuť je velmi výrazná, silně kvasnicová s jemným ovocným nádechem, fini je středně hořký a drící. V ústech pivo působí mohutně, má silnějí říz a je hůře pitelné. jedná se o velmi zajímavý leák, mohutné, výrazné chuti, i přes to jsem čekal trochu víc, ale rozhodně to není ádné zklamání.
Backlog. On tap at Maltes Öltipspromenad 2013. Dominated by sweet caramel.
Tap. Gassy clear golden color. Medium size, thick white head, stays. Metallic, hops, malty and sour notes in aroma. Sweet, malty, hop pellets, dry in flavor. Hoppy bite in aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Tap (Koht, Tallinn)
Grainy aroma, some sweet, some rough aspects. Straw colour, persistent head. DMW, were you responsible for MCE on the n900? Because this is truly one of the shittest pieces of software Ive ever had the displeasure of having to be victim of. Fuck system software, you may have been better than the browser team, but thats saying that retards are smarter than monkeys. Anyway, as I have to type my fucking review at this keyboard, I may as well as cover the beer as well as insult the people who make seeing the keyboard hard. Pretty rough lager in the taste, not a pleasant thirst quencher at all. Possibly an overrate, but I like the fact it kept its head.

Vycap Richtar Jakub. Zlata farba, pena pekna biela, husta. Vona chmelova, travnata s citrusovymi tonmi. Chut velmi osviezujuca s lahkym sladovym zakladom a prijenou horkostou. Pekne pivo plzenskeho typu.

PET from Cesky Brod-Liblice , CZ , Unfiltered version , Malt,bread,biscuit,fruity and grassy aroma , Bit hazy golden color with bigger lacing head , Sweeter taste with nice bitter finish , Medium body , Soft carbon , Very pleasant Czech craft lager.

Certainly the best Czech pilsener Ive had. This is huge on the palate with a great aroma of sour plums and apples, mash malt, and light saaz hops. Pours cloudy orange with great head and lacing. Finishes with light sourness and some crisp barley notes. Palate is big, slightly thick and creamy with soft carbonation. Tap at Churchkey.

On tap @ Les Trois 8 (Paris). Clear yellow/golden with a small fully lasting white head and intense lacing. Aroma is of breadied malt, cereals, saaz, grass and some sweetness. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with breadied malt and grass. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Somewhat dry finish. Crisp and clean. Drinkable aplenty and quite refreshing. Nice balance. Really good!
This one poured a golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of grassy and herbal hops with some cracker notes. Flavor was similar, bright noble hop tastes, doughy too.
1.5liter plasticbottle from Maria bottle shop in Krakow. Maby the plastic bottle didnt do this beer any good. Head all gone. Would love to try it fresh from tap tho. :)

Draught. Aroma is malty, with some butterscotch, but also with a classy hoppy aroma. Beautiful frothy head, which lasts very long. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Goes well with food. Perfect example of style.

On tap at rlrl. Yeasty bread-like aromas. Pours slightly hazy golden blond with a very thick dense white head. Crisp lager, malts upfront with balancing grassy notes, hints of light fruits with traces of dough. Finishes with a spicy dry grassy flavor. Excellent! Love the lively carbonation and smooth body.

Bottled. Not as perfect as the kvasnicove version, but very good indeed. A bit darkened golden body with very nice foam. Aroma of hops with a bit of honey. Tastes more malty but ends by a good dry hoppy finish. Very-very nice

One of the best Czech lagers.
Golden color, good carbonation. Noble hops aroma, some bread and malty. Good bitterness.
Draught at William K. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, grass, salted crackers and malts. Bitter finish with citrus, salted crackers and hops. Very nice pilsner.
Tap at Angleterre, Helsinki. Colour is clear golden with thick small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.-- via beerbasher/winphone Lumia 800

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, clear. Some florals on nose, slight buttery nice soft czech pilsner malts. Lightish, a bit bitter, body. Honey malts, hoppy flavours. Really nice czech- style mass produced pilsener. Soft malty flavours, but quite a lot of hops for the style. Flavourful.
Tap. Clear golden color with a thin white head. Aroma of hay, honey and sugary hops. Medium bitter taste with sweet and bitter finish. A bit sticky feel. Lively carbonation.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Tap at Kaisla, Helsinki. Pours clear bronze with a medium white head. Aroma of grainy maltiness and hay with a metallic note in it as well. Taste has pale, clearly lager-like maltiness and a little balancing hoppiness in the finish. Grainy flavours, maybe some slightly herbal notes also. Palate is low to medium bodied, slick. This felt a bit one-dimensional; Czechs have better pilseners.

Draught. Pours clear golden in color with a small head. Sweetish malty notes, some buttery notes as well in aroma. Light grassy bitterness in taste with some toasty malty and buttery notes being present too. Leaves one with a slightly bitter aftertaste however. Nice pils.

Tap at Redlight. Gold pour with a big pillow white head. Bready slightly sweet aroma. Smooth crisp malt with a slight grassy hop bite. Awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

RLRL for Zwanze day. A bit sweeter than Id expect from a Czech Pils, but otherwise really solid stuff, nice grassy hop aroma and easy to drink lots of. A nice break from all the sours and stouts tried that day.

(Flasche) es hat eine goldgelbe Farbe, ist opaleszierend mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich und würzig. Der Geschmack ist etwas schlank, würzig, etwas süß, ohne Bittere und mit wenig CO2
On tap. Pours pale golden color with white head. Aroma of malt, hops, quite yeasty. Taste medium bitter, light sour, yeasty. Average beer.

Draft at Churchkey. Beautiful opaque golden pour, lovely frothy white head. Nose and flavor are similar to the 10 but a bit more aggressive with the Saaz hoppiness and the lightest tart aspects as well. Big spicy, floral, herbal hop character, gorgeous effervescence. Lovely stuff.
Clean, crisp almost airy louthfeel. Not as much tartness as some kegs. So easy to put down.

Golden, fluffy white head. Nose is fresh malts, bread, grass, musk, lemon and a touch of funk, almost gueuze-like. Taste is super juicy fruits, lemon, grassy hops, more juiciness at the end and big fresh saaz hops linger after the dry bitter finish. Very crisp clean mouthfeel. Never expected to be blown away by a pilsner.

Draft @ Fari Hatten, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy bitter grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy bitter finish.

Fat. Far i Hatten, Malmö. Gyllengul öl med kraftigt vitt skum som lämnar fantastiska skumgardiner på glaset. Doft av bröd, spannmål, gräs och lätta citrustoner. Samma återkommer i smaken. En riktigt bra tjeck.

Pale orange color with 2 finger creamy white head. Aroma of straw. saaz hops, yeasty. Taste is light sweet with nice bitterness and just a bit dry. Light to medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Good Pilsner.

1,5l PET. Elegant simplicity at its best. Pale, bready malt with a generous addition of green Saaz hops. Medium body, hoppy taste, with a brilliant, strong bitterness. Aftertaste of bread and Saaz. Thumbs up!

Tap @ U Slovanske Lipy, Prague. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a creamy white head, leaving nice lacings. Aroma of bready malt, sweet fruit, oranges, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, bread, peach, oranges, herbal and grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, refrshing lightly bitter finish. 280313

On tap at U Slovanske Lipy (02/03/13). Nefiltrovanoe. Rather clear gold pour, very pretty rocky white head, light lacing. Very aromatic, crisp fresh bready grain, baguette crust but with a ton of very grassy saaz in there as well, ever so slight metallic note. Taste is grainy upfront, fresh bread crust, herbal and dry finish, tea herbal finish. Excellent, but not quite as the greats I had on this trip.

On tap at Avenue Pub. Pours a hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of light fruits, bready malt, hint of skunk, peppery spices. Flavor of honey, sweet bready malt, with sweetness in the finish. A bit odd but its pretty decent and drinkable.
6/4/7/4/14 (3.5/5)

this for me was as close to Bohemian lager perfection as I have ever experienced, pouring a dark golden with a tight rocky head. In the mouth it was sheer delight of bready malt and that lemony/hay thing that just screams Saaz., I am not sure I have ever enjoyed a pint of bottom-fermented beer so much.

Tap at Churchkey. Rating #5200! On tap as "Koutska 12° (Unfiltered/ Unpasteurized)" so I think this rating belongs here as raw krausen was probably not added to the keg here- no heavy yeast in suspension haze. Pours a clearish, low haze, brilliant bright orange, rocky white head. Perfect sheets of white lacing on both full pours I had. Nose is soft valencia orange, sweet peach, butterscotch, pear, mild apple. Taste is spicy, big Saaz hops, sharp metallic notes at first. After warming the harsh metallic twang is gone and replaced by super herbal hoppiness, peach cobbler, crackery pale malt, dried orange. Body is quenching, refreshing, not sticky, not watery. Wow. This is what I needed. 7/5/9/5/16=4.2
draft at Blue Monk, lighter copper gold pour, noble hop, grassy aroma & flavor. touch of malty sweetness to balance a good dose of grassy bitterness. Nice pilsner

Keg at U Slovanske Lipy. Tried alongside the Unfiltered. I think the unfiltered won but this was excelent too. Pours deep Golden with a thick White head. Hoppy aroma. The flavour has a lot of Malt character tied together by the grassy straw hops. A wonderful balance which leads to a satisfying bitter finish. A fine balanace and a king among Pilsners.

(draught 0,5l @ Pivnice Kocour (Brno))
Malty, light hops aroma. Clear golden color. All time white head. Medium sweet, light bitter, some herbal/spicy notes. Medium body. Nice bitter finish.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a medium sized head of foamy fine to large sized white colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a uncarbonated transparent orange colored body and a fair lacing. The mild aroma was malty with a straw note. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of hops and malt. An OK brew just nothing special.

On tap at Armsby for Zwanze day.  This is the second time Ive had a Pilsner that has blown me away (the first was Uprights Pils).  Light toasty herbal spicy aroma.  Taste is really crisp clean noble hops with great light biscuit malts.  Fantastic.
wow thus is awesome, huge bright noble hop presence, perfect body love it.
Golden clear color with white head, malt aroma with herbal, grass and floral notes. Taste is light sweet with finish in bitterness, good balanced.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Helsinki (2011). Golden color, white head. Citric hop flavor, strong malty base with a hint of alcohol. Medium body, medium-high carbonation. Not a great pilsener.

21/07 Grand Tasting, tap at Rychtar Jakub, Bratislava during RBESG GT. I was in doubt should I even rate it, as obviously it was not in its meant shape, but as I did with all such beers so far, Ill rerate ASAP. Anyway, it had clear golden body with small head. Buttery aroma, popcorn, hay. Lot of yeast in its flavor, butter all the way around, messed up with nice Bohemian herbal hops. Medium bodied with long, acidic finish. It showed some of its qualities and it was very drinkable, but whether is the batch or the storage, it needs a rerate!

Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Medium white head. Clear golden colour. Aroma malt, some hops. Taste medium bitter, light sour. Pretty average, nothing special. Probably need to revisit this in the future, fell well below the expectations.

RBESG 12, Bratislava. Grand Tasting at Richtar Jakub. Tap. This mustve been a bad batch, or theres something wrong with RJs pipes. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is light buttery, light malty, leaves. Flavour is light malty, buttery, light floral, light bitter grassy finish. Light bodied. There were quite some things off here.
Bottle @ RBESG Grand Tasting 2012. Golden appearance with a white head. Buttery toffee, straw aroma. Watery, pale grainy, butterscotch flavor. I think this batch got fucked up.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 Golden misty and white head. Classic European hops, pilsner yeasty. Quite bitter, long dry bitter aftertaste. My original rating was pour but its a great pilsner, cheap and Flavourful. Really nice and easy to drink all night, despite the spritzy carbonation. (Originally drank in Czech Republic, current rating in Les Trois 8)
Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub.Dark golden color with thick white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, bitter hops. Taste, sweet malt, yeast, bitter hops. Dry bitter finish. Nice one.

Draught @ Beer OClock 2, Bucharest.

Golden colour with orange hints, clear liquid, long white lacing head.

Aroma has notes of hops, citrus, herbs.

Full body, perfect carbonation, bittersweet  taste, bitter aftertaste.

(on tap) Golden colour, foamy white head, clear. Czech aroma hops all over the place, with grassy, hay and herbal aroma) alng with a solid grainy malty body and maybe traces of honey. No buttery aroma whatsoever in this one. Light to medium bitterness, very lightly sweet. Overall very well-baalanced. I enjoyed this one a lot!
Assaggiata al pils pride...degna di nota, ottimo finale erbaceo e secco...tra i migliori della serata...

Drafted at Klub Malych Pivovaru in Pilsen..Light golden with a Fluffy white head.Aroma of,grain,grass,oats,herbs,nuts.It tastes buttery and creamy with flavors of crisp grassy hops, honey,butterscotch with a nice malty balance..
A very good beer to be drinking on a hot day!

On tap @ BeerBier, Bp.
Golden yellow coloured with a whipped creamy and lasting head, which remains finger thick.
Citrus-fruity and malty smell.
Tasteing starts sharp followed by a citrus-fruity aroma escorted by honey, breadcrust, florals and herbs, mouthfeel is syrupy.
It finishes long and sweetbitter with spices and citrusses, which leaves a herbal-hoppy aftertaste behind.
Balanced, enjoyable one.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2012 Gold lager, lasting creamy head. Aromatic hops provide the herbal grassy nose. Medium body with perfect carbon. Taste is really bitter. Quina on palate. Also bitter chocolade tones. Good hop on finish. [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Alla spina allOpen Baladin, Roma; una buona pils con sentori erbacei e di camomilla.

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Clear colden orange colored pilsner with frothy head. Hoppy grass and malty hay aroma. Bitter-sweet hoppy taste.Light body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Medium long light bitter finish. Its a nice pilsner, delicious one.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.
Közepesen sötét, aranysárga színe van, habja fehér, méretes, kemény és krémes, igen kitartó. Illata virágos, zöld füves, enyhén vizes pokrócos, komlós és kissé karamellás. Ízében nagyon szépen egyensúlyozik egymással a finom, édeskés maláta és a növényes, kesernyés komló, amik mellé betársul némi fűszer és vajkaramella is. Könnyű teste van de mégsem vizes és kellemesen buborékos. Utóíze keserédes, enyhén gyógynövényes és száraz. Ez az a fajta sör, amiből hektó számra tud fogyasztani az ember egy jó társaságban. Nagyon jó!

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. Áttetsző arany színű pilzeni, melynek tetején egészen kitartóan közepes méretű, szivacsos fehér hab foglal helyet. Illata malátás, élesztős és füvesen komlós. Habár ízében sem fedezni fel semmi szokatlant vagy különlegeset, de fantasztikus kiegyensúlyozottsága folytán egy elképesztően jó cseh világosról van szó! Közepesen testes, cseh komló uralta keserű ízvilággal rendelkező, száraz és épp csak kellően szénsavas pilzeni. Élmény volt.

On tap, Csakajósör, Budapest.
The beer has a nice golden appearance with a foamy white head. Herbal-floral hop aroma with a well balanced malt, yeast. Easy drinkable but smooth mouthfeel, medium body, well balanced malt and yeast with a good little bubbles, fine hop with herbs and florals, bittersweet aftertaste, nice hop cones on the tongue. Really good pilsner!
SMÖF 2011. Golden beer, small head. Fruity aroma, hops, citrus and some grass. Fruity citrus flavor, elder notes, hops, grass and some metal.
Sample at SMÖF 2011. It poured a hazy golden liquid with a white head. Mild smell with some pale malts. Similar taste with some heather. Easy to drink and nice.

Sample @ SMÖF 2011. Pours clear pale amber with a small off white head. Aroma is malty, sourish, bready and a bit smokey. Flavor is acidy, malty, fruity, sweet and bitter; very nice. Finishes bitter sweet and malty.
Sampled at SMÖF 2011. Pours golden with no real head. Smells bready malty. Tastes bready malty, raisins abit bubbly with a similar finish.

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours hazy yellow with small lasting head. Apricot, citrus, grass and some notes of glue on the nose. Flavor is grassy hops, citrus, some malts and notes of butter. Medium carbonation and somewhat bitter palate with a bit sour finish.
2434

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Helsinki
Deep copper-golden color, active carbonation, good cloudy off-white head. Berryish woody hoppy nose. Nutty-woody malt backbone with slightly buttery, woody hoppy and citrusy notes. Feels lifeless despite of extra carbonation. I am swimming against the stream with this one.

Draught @Rotterdam, Helsinki. Poured clear golden with a very nice looking creamy head. Very high carbonation. Aroma is citrus, hint of diacetyl and grass. Fruity flavored, citrus and malt with a mild bitterness. Not watery, but light to medium bodied. Very smooth and refreshing, excellent brew!! Could drink this every day.

Draught @ Slovanske Lipy. I loved the 10 from the Kout brewery and had to taste this one aswell. I was not dissapointed. This is a very rich and deep pilsener. Very fruity. Lots of orange and dried apricot notes. Heavier than the 10, but not too heavy to be super drinkable.

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu.
Pours a light copper colour with a small, thick, lacy head. Aroma of sweet grainy malts, grass, caramel and nuts. Flavour of sweet grainy malts, toffee, nuts and grassy hops. Smooth mouthfeel with a bitter, bready finish. Well balanced.

(Draught at Kittys, Helsinki, 20110715) The beer poured deep golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass, herbalness, grain and mildly butter. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, fruitiness, herbalness, grain, mildly sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter. A really tasty Czech pils. Perhaps would be even better when fresher and unfiltered.

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere
Aroma is fresh and mild and has hints of butterish malt. and herbs. Refrreshing taste lacks the typical butter aroma in czech pilseners. It has some grassy hops and hints of herbs. Balanced and good pilsener that could have some more character though.

Draught @ Oluthuone Rotterdam, Helsinki

Pours clear with golden color and a smooth head. Aroma has notes of grass, pine and spices. Taste is extremely smooth with notes of malts, fruits and slightly hops. Nice smooth finish. Great, well balanced pilsner, but couldve used some more hops and bitterness.

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa, Rome. Pours clear golden with a big creamy and fluffy white head. Aroma is full of lemons and spicy hops. Taste is first of all balanced, good bisquity malts and loads of fresh and crisp hops. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, extreme drinkability and very moreish beer.
Ke kartam super, ale jinak uplne normalni dvanactka. Hodne svetle, chutove malo vyrazne. Nic extra.

on draught @ Open Baladin. Golden color with a thick white head. Bready, and chamomile aroma. Intense taste of pilsner malt, acacia honey  and biscuit, well balanced by herbal bitterness of saaz hop.
The Best Bohemian Pilsner at this moment.

On draught at Open Baladin Rome. Pours a clear gold color with a sod lasting white head. slight hoppy aroma. Medium body. Crisp hop flavor and mellow bitterness is dulled by a honey-like flavor and slight sulfury notes. Fairly clean, and not slinky like the local botled 
Pilsner Urquell.

Draught, at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague. Maybe is was because I had it on a very hot, sunny day after lots of walking, but I found this even better than the unfiltered version. Pretty dark gold-almost amber, with a pillowy head. Grassz hop aroma, some citrus, rich malts. Lovely hop flavor with great bitterness--though not too much--with delicious, soft, biscuity malts and cereals and a touch of honey. Low carbonation, smooth, full yet light, crisp and super refreshing. Perfect.

On tap in Praha at U Slovanske Lipy.  Simply delicious and gaining appreciation for this style.  Best Czech Pils we had in Praha.  Nice and hoppy aroma and flavor plus bitterness.  Apparently they use only Saaz.  They also had the unfiltered version but it was a bit yeasty for us.  Not in bottles so you are going to have to get it on tap somewhere.
on tap at Danup in Hradec Kralove. Very drinkable beer,clear golden color, interesting taste. very good beer.

Tap @ U Slovanske Lipy, Prague. Pours clear golden with a lasting creamy white head. Nose is fresh of yeast, lemon, hops and grass. Taste has a bit of buiscuit and loads of fresh and flavorfull hops. Medium and smooth body. What a quaffable and tasty Pils. Im in love with these Kout beers!

Colore dorato chiaro, con una spessa achiuma quasi dorata. Leggero aroma di burro,mais,aceto,miele e malto leggero. Aroma leggermente piccante a base di erbe e fiori di luppolo con un pò di malto . Corpo rotondo e un finale amaro pronunciato.

On tap in Klatovy. Really nice pilsener, a style for which my appreciation waxes and wanes (especially when I drink too much of it in Czech). Very good balance of flavours, with nothing really standing out (as it probably shouldnt) but some tasty caramel and buttery hoppiness.

(tap at Zly Casy, Praha) A dark golden beer with a tint of amber and a yellowish foam. the aroma is boring with some diacetyle. Way too sweet taste with low bitterness and low palate. Quite boring overall.

Bready, hop proflie ok
Amber, creamy eggshell head
Chewy a bit fruit, good hops
Very drinkable

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2009 (draught, at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague) pours a clear golden colour with a tall, creamy semi-golden head. subdued aroma of butter, corn and vinegar and light honeyed pale malts. flavour is lightly spicy floral and herbal hops with some grainy pale malts. round body with smooth carbonation and a pronounced bitter finish.
On tap. Pours a warm deep golden with a dense, white head leaving laces. Fantastic clean malt aroma with lovely floral accents. Medium body, very clean maltiness and a dry bitterness. 260608
Clear golden with large white head. Sweet fruity aroma with hoppy and caramel notes. Sweet flavor with caramel, hoppy and mild fruity notes. Well carbonated. Ends bitter.

(6/23/08) Draught at Zlý Casy in Prague. Hazy deep golden-amber with a medium stable off-white head. Aroma of malt, some toastiness, some yeast. Sweet malty flavor with a nice caramelly tone. Medium-bodied a very silky rounded mouthfeel. Very good.
6/4/7/4/14=3.5

(6/26/08) Draught at Koutland in Plzen. Clear golden color with a white head, Aroma has some grass and some maltiness. Sweetish flavor with some light honey notes and some nice bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied.
6/3/7/3/14=3.3

(6/29/08) Draught at Koutland in Plzen. Great hoppy bitterness. Nice rounded mouthfeel with soft carbonation.
6/4/7/4/14=3.5
Draught at Koutland in Plzen. Clear golden - white head. Grainy, egg, white bread, light flowery, nice malty, grains, nice freshness. Ok - a bit butter/diacetyl and sourness.
On tap @ Koutland, Plzen. Brown and reddish in colour with a medium sized head. Quite nice and refreshing with notes of bread, hay, grain and hops.
Tap @ Koutland, Plzen. Pours a beautyful red/orange with a small white head. Aroma is nice, fresh and malty. Flavour is great - malty aswell with a dry hoppy finish.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen.
Dark golden coloured, medium sized white head, grassy nose. Sweet malty, fresh hoppy and light yeasty taste with dry, bitter and very hoppy finish. Nice easy drinkable bohemian pils.

(Draught) Pours golden with a small creamy head. The aroma is sweet malty, light buttery and  bit cookie-like with floral hops to back it up. The flavour is light to medium sweet with bready/cookie-like malt  and grassy/light floral bitter hops. The mouthfeel is crisp and dry with a numbing touch from the hops.  Medium bodied. Nice!

Tap @ Koutland, Plzen.
Pours deep, clear, golden with some coppery character to it. A medium, creamy, stable and lightly off-white head settles atop it. Aroma is soft, good maltiness and very crisp hops with biscuity notes. High carbonation, but still very creamy. Flavour is wonderful, lots of malty crispness and character, before finishing of with a sharp, dry and hoppy ending.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen. Gold with white head. Malty pilsener with a delicate lemony hop in the background. Quite thinnish in character, lacking a little oomph and just a touch of a cereal note. Beginning to get dry enough, but there was a butterscotch note there. Went back on Sunday to try again and still didn’t quite get it. Sorry folks.
On tap at Koutland, Plzen.  Gold, lasting cream head.  Slight grassy hop aroma.  Hmmm, really good drinkability.  Fine.  Good hop on finish.  Grassy.  Again a bit of earthiness as it warms up.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen.  
Clear golden colour. Very fresh, malty and flowery aroma. Good smooth, chewy mouthfeel, yet bit powdery. Very fruity with medium bitterness. Bready, fresh and hoppy overall.

From tap at Koutland. Pours clear and golden yellow to orange with and light lacing white head. Medium dry malt aroma with a light spice note. Flavour is mild spiced and medium dry bitter. Smooth and light fruity towards the finish.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2017 2008 and 2017....Golden with a lasting off-white head. Crisp malt aroma with bread and grain, with hoppy notes like grass and hay mostly. Clean and dry malty flavour. Awesome work on the malt, great hops.
Tap at koutland. Alround rating: Pale lager malts, floural and yeasty, cornish dycetyl note is clean and drinmkable.

Draught at Koutland.  Clear deep golden, small head. POwerful grassy nose. Quite dry with light-medium body. Clean bready dense malt accompanied by almost licorice-liek grassy hops. Long bitter finish. Less soft than the 12° kvasnicovy, and also missing a bit of the lovely diacetyl. Still really good!

Draft. A dark golden beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty with primary notes of caramel as well as hints of straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, caramel, and malt, leading to a dry bitter finish.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2009 Draught at Koutland, Plzen, Czech Republic. Clear golden, medium white head. Bready and bisquity malts with floral and grassy hops. Long bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2008 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Casy. Orange colour, mediumsized white creamy head. Aroma is a bit barnyard which meets fruits, malts and some yeast. Flavour is very fruity, almost junipery and also has some reddish berries in it. 7 4 8 3 15

Aroma is malts, caramel, quite much grass and a lot of diacetyl. Flavour is big bitterness with balancing sugar, some yeast and caramel. 7 3 7 3 14

At the Koutland in Plzen, supplied by omhper (thanks a lot!) A darker orange/amber body. I deserve to be slapped for rating this after only having it on a tired palate... Again with the sweetish malty and yeasty yoghurty nose, but with a strong hoppy presence. A strong taste and yet superbly balanced between the lovely hopiness (my notes say "hop" at least three times in two rows, thats how great it was.) and a maltiness that was ever so slightly eggy. I want to get this again.

aroma: fresh malt, toasted malt, light hops, clean, crisp
appearance: golden-orange, small white head and lacing
flavor: toasted malt, roasted spiced apples, grains, wheat, oats, oranges, pineapple, grassiness
palate: smooth, malty, grain, light, roasted apples

Clear honey yellow colored body.  Nose of mild soapy yeast and citrus fruit melon, mango, oranges, etc.  Rich, big, sticky palate, tasting of lemons, oranges, pineapple, along with some mild minerally yeast.  Clean and sweet and fruity malt base, some red apple skins and dried oranges develop over time.  Refreshing and unique.

On tap at Koutland, Plzen Czech Repuiblic with "the montelpogo".  .3L  A nice darker amber with some umnber tones.  Lots of sticky whole veils of laving. Body is deep and sweet but somehow understated by the yeastyness and strong tones of whole hops.  "Im a like a leaf floating down the river enjoying myself with a gentle spice hop infusion"  yeah...looking at my scribblings now is pretty funny but this was the 7th or 8th beer of the afternoon/evening and there was a fair ammount of walking to be considered.  I thouroughly enjoyedthis kout beer,  but wait....theres more to come.....

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at Koutland, Pilsen, Czech Republic
The look: Clear golden body with a large white head
To me a typical Czech Světlý 12° and above is: Well malted body with plenty of biscuits and cereals.  Sweetness level is in the light-medium range with some honey flavours and a light caramel presence (3/4 honey, 1/4 caramel).  Fruity flavour limited to a light citrus flavour.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is dry and moderately bitter with a light citric touch.  After-taste of dry grassy/herbal hops with a light dry spiciness character.
This one: As above, a typical 12° Světlý but with everything just done almost perfectly.  As far as regular Světlý (non-oak barrel aged) this one was second only to the Svatý Norbert Velikonoční 13°.  I went back a few times to Koutland to drink more of it just to make sure that it was so good (for the science)

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Koutland (Plzen, Rép. Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur dhoublon floral et de céréale. Apparence: La couleur est orangée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dhoublon et de cérérale. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréale en arrière goût. (Rating #1549)

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2013 My Bottom Line:
Herbal tangerine hoppiness swings its fresh hips to the delight of the honeyed hay which cannot help but join in the dance up close to create an immensely refreshing and snappy Světlý Leák.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A trustworthy head of foam stays atop the translucent blond.
-The grassy, herbal hoppiness even recalls fresh dill at times.
-The hop bitterness is scrumptiously long but the malt knows how to keep it in check at all times.
-This is a tad more intense in its hoppiness than the usual Bohemian Pilsener, but it is by no means aggressive, nor is it an IPA version of the style.
-I feel privileged to have been able to spend an entire evening drinking pints of this, over and over and over. Thats a sign I liked it, right? ;)

On tap at Koutland, Plzen, U Slovanské Lipy and Kulovy Blesk, Praha.

Draught at Koutland, Pilsen. Deep golden coloured. Rather big aroma with plenty of floral Saazer hops and freshly baked bread. Also some nice eggy notes in the background. The flavour is sweet and bready at first, then it becomes more and more hoppy. The hops never overpower the nice maltiness though. The finish is dry with a lingering hop bitterness. Chewy mouthfeel. Perfectly balanced. One of very few beers I could never get tired of. Truly a world class brew.

Draught, Domazlice.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is dark yellow to light amber.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs, orange), with a note of honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Wonderful pils.  Very classy and balanced and juicy.  Fil is a lucky guy to be able to drink this any day of the week.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2007 On tap (Koutland, Pilsen): Deep golden, extremely long-lasting, almost off-white head, full oaky-resinous hoppy nose with a solid sweet-malty background, full aromatic-bitter and sweet flavour, medium bodied, robust malty base, lingering hoppy finish, the umbels stick to the palate. Beautiful, the archtypal Bohemian Pilsener.......

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2007 Tap at Koutland. Aroma on this one is slightly more "classic" - hops are more spicy and integrated but still retaining that huge Kout hoppy freshness. Sulfur and fruitiness is very low in this one but the malt is big, clean and assertive. Clean malt and hops and finishes much more bitter than the other Kouts, which I like. Really, really, really good. The textbook Czech 12% in my mind.

Etwas ungewöhnlicher, wenn auch ausbalanciert malziger Geruch. Prickelnd im Antrunk, etwas holzig-malzig und ziemlich herb. Die Herbe zieht sich durch den kompletten Verlauf und kennzeichnet diesen enorm. Neben der sehr kräftigen Herbe können sich auch die süsslich-malzigen Noten und die fruchtigen Akzente profilieren. Noch herberer Abgang, der eigentlich fast alle anderen Aromen zum Schweigen bringt. Zu empfehlen, aber für mich nicht das beste Bier der Brauerei!

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2009 First rating(Draught at Koutland, Plzen. Thanks motelpogo for the tip!) Clear deep golden color, or something - still dark pub, white head. Hoppy and roasted scent. Very very hoppy taste, nice and bitter. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness.6/3/8/3/14=3.4Rerate(Draught at Zlý Casy in Prague on June 23, 2008)Shady golden color, white creamy head. Sweet and herbal hoppy scent. Tangerine, citrus, lemon taste. A bit caramelly as well. Spritzy mouthfeel, low to medium bitterness.6/4/6/3/12=3.1Rerate(Draught in Plzen)On June 26, 2008Clear golden color, creamy white head. Yeasty, sweet, herbal hoppy taste. Medium mouthfeel and bitterness. Sweet malty scent.6/4/8/3/14=3.5RerateAs "Koutska Dvanactka Svetly Lezak 12°"Draught at the Czech Beer Festival, on May 22, 2009Clear golden color, big rocky almost orange head. Sweet, malty, herbal hoppy taste. Hoppy aftertaste. Herbal hoppy scent. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.8/5/8/3/17=4.1

Beautiful golden body, creamy white head, lacing; The nose is very similar to the Koutský 10° Světlé Výčepní also with lots of dry earthy hop aromas and fresh malt behind it is just quite a bit bigger and the malt is a bit more apparent; Huge big bubbled carbonation on bitter balanced complex body, lots of character and great; Long finish with quite a bit of earthy hop aromas, a little to much plain malty warmth in finish, also a little much malty bitterness. Great beer, I think a little to much malt aromas compared to the hop profile of the nose brings this beer a very little out of balance.
on tap at Koutská pivnice in Domazlice. Large head, intensive hoppy nose. Quite hoppy taste, flowery hoppy, not bitter. Combined with fine malty aromas this makes a very intensive tasting lager.

Pretty much the perfect Bohemian Pilsner for me. Probably a touch more hoppy and floral than your average Bohemian, but just so well balanced and unbelievably more-ish. Some nice apricot fruit notes, grassy and as mentioned quite buttery (but not in a diacetyl-y sort of way). Finish is softly bitter, perfectly bitter, makes you want another sip and another. Wow.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2007 re-rate: koutland might be a bit of a dump but i cant help but keep going back for this stuff, often just with some PET bottles in hand which they dutifully fill. anyways, this gets better every time i drink it, so balanced, so bitter, an amazing splotchy head, the perfect beer, as far as im concerned. on tap at U kodovky in pilsen. utterly still amber colour - looks like honey, big and frothy off-white head that refused to go away. fresh saaz aroma - grassy, faintly minty, hugely buttery texture reminiscent of krakonos, decent bitterness, lightly metallic but in a good way, classy stuff from a very exciting brewery
